intro: Lobelia kalobaensis, commonly known as the Kaloba lobelia, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of East Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and lance-shaped, while its stems are often hairy. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
